item.title: Oppo Reno 13 Pro, Reno 13 to launch in India next month: Here’s what the smartphones will offer - The Times of India
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 Pro, Reno 13 to launch in India next month: Here’s what the smartphones will offer

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

The Oppo Reno 13 Pro and Reno 13 are set to launch in India next month, offering advanced features and improvements over their predecessors.

  • The Reno 13 Pro is expected to feature upgraded camera technology.
  • Both models may include enhanced battery life and faster charging options.
  • New design aesthetics are anticipated, making them visually appealing.
"We aim to deliver cutting-edge technology that exceeds customer expectations." - Oppo Representative

This launch could strengthen Oppo's position in the competitive smartphone market in India.

item.title: Apple to Kick Off M5 Chip Development in H1 2025 With Separate CPU-GPU Design: Ming-Chi Kuo - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Apple's M5 Chipset Will Likely Enter Mass Production Next Year

Publication Date: December 5, 2024
Source: Gadgets 360

Apple will initiate mass production of its M5 family of chipsets in the first half of 2025, leveraging TSMC's advanced 3nm node technology. This development promises improved performance and efficiency over previous chipsets.

  • The M5 chip will be part of a new chipset family, including M5 Pro, Max, and Ultra variants.
  • Manufacturing will utilize TSMC's N3P technology, expected to deliver a 5% performance gain.
  • Apple's innovative SoIC-mH design could lead to a space reduction of 30-50% compared to traditional SoC designs.
  • The M5 chip may feature separate CPU and GPU designs, enhancing performance for AI tasks.
“This unconventional design could take up 30-50 percent less space than conventional system-on-chip (SoC).” - Ming-Chi Kuo

This new chipset is anticipated to significantly boost Apple's computational capabilities, especially in handling AI tasks, and ensure their devices remain competitive in a rapidly evolving tech landscape.

item.title: iPhone 17 Pro Max, iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone 17 Air, iPhone 17: Expected Price To Launch Date, Here's What To Expe - Times Now
item.description:
iPhone 17 Lineup: Expected Features, Design Changes, and Launch Information

Publication Date: Not provided Source: Not provided

Apple is gearing up for its most ambitious iPhone launch yet in 2025, featuring major design updates and a new model.

  • Four models anticipated: iPhone 17, iPhone 17 Pro, iPhone 17 Pro Max, and iPhone 17 Air.
  • iPhone 17 Air expected to be the thinnest iPhone at 6.25 mm.
  • Pro and Pro Max will likely feature aluminum and glass designs for durability.
  • All models may feature ProMotion technology with 120Hz refresh rates.
  • 24MP front cameras across all models; Pro Max to have three 48MP lenses.
  • Rumored launch in September with starting prices around Rs 1,19,900 for Pro models.
"The iPhone 17 Air might replace the ‘Plus’ model, offering a new mid-size option between the standard and Pro models."

The upcoming iPhone 17 lineup is set to introduce significant advancements and a potentially new direction for Apple's smartphone offerings.

item.title: Facebook-parent Meta may have a new ‘plan’ to compete with Apple Vision Pro - The Times of India
item.description:
Meta's New Strategy to Compete with Apple Vision Pro

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Tech News Daily

Meta, the parent company of Facebook, is reportedly developing a new plan to compete with Apple's Vision Pro headset, indicating an ongoing rivalry in the tech space.

  • Meta is focusing on enhancing its virtual reality technologies.
  • The company aims to capture a larger market share in augmented reality.
  • Insights from industry experts suggest that the competition may lead to innovative developments.
“This could reshape the landscape of augmented reality and virtual reality,” said a leading tech analyst.

This strategic move by Meta signifies its commitment to being a key player in the evolving tech environment and ensuring that it does not fall behind its competitors.

item.title: Apple Could Replace Your Door Lock Keys With Face ID For Home Security: Know More - News18
item.description:
Apple Could Replace Your Door Lock Keys With Face ID For Home Security: Know More

Last Updated: December 23, 2024, 21:39 IST

Apple is preparing to delve deeper into the smart home market with a new Face ID-enabled door lock system in 2025. This new technology could revolutionize home security by allowing users to enter their homes through facial recognition, potentially increasing safety and privacy.

  • Apple is targeting the smart home segment, historically overlooked by the company.
  • The potential product combines Face ID technology with smart door locks for enhanced security.
  • Apple aims to convince consumers of the security and privacy of their biometric data.
  • The new feature may integrate with third-party smart locks.
  • The expected launch for this technology is in late 2025.
“The security of Face ID makes it reliable enough to be integrated for doors.”

This new venture signifies Apple’s commitment to expanding its product offerings in the face of stagnating iPhone sales, demonstrating the importance of diversifying its technology portfolio.

item.title: Nothing Phone 3a could pack major SoC and camera upgrades - Android Police
item.description:
Nothing Phone 3a Could Pack Major SoC and Camera Upgrades

Publication Date: N/A Source: Android Police

This article discusses the rumored upgrades for the upcoming Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Plus, including potential new chipsets and improved camera capabilities.

  • Nothing plans to upgrade the SoCs in its mid-range phones, potentially using Qualcomm's Snapdragon 7s Gen 3.
  • Improvements in camera hardware are expected, including a telephoto camera for the 3a and a periscope zoom for the 3a Plus.
  • There are suggestions that the new devices might support eSIM technology.
"While this isn't a big deal, there is added convenience by being able to purchase a SIM on the fly without having to head into a store."

In conclusion, the anticipated upgrades for Nothing's mid-range lineup indicate a significant leap in performance and features, with potential effects that could enhance user experience and market competitiveness.

item.title: Hotfixes for Sophos firewall vulnerabilities released - SC Media
item.description:
Hotfixes for Sophos Firewall Vulnerabilities Released

Date: December 19, 2024

Source: SC World

Hotfixes have been revealed for three vulnerabilities affecting Sophos Firewall versions 21.0 GA and older, two of which were of critical severity.

  • Critical vulnerabilities include CVE-2024-12727 (SQL injection) and CVE-2024-12728 (weak credentials).
  • Exploitation risks include remote code execution and account exposure.
  • Organizations are advised to limit SSH access and deactivate WAN access while waiting for official patches.
"According to Sophos, exploitation could affect nearly 0.05% and almost 0.5% of Sophos firewalls, respectively."

This update aims to secure Sophos Firewall users against significant vulnerabilities that pose serious risks.

item.title: WhatsApp To Stop Working On These Android Phones From January 2025: Full List - News18
item.description:
WhatsApp To Stop Working On These Android Phones From January 2025: Full List

Date: December 23, 2024

Source: News18

WhatsApp is going to stop working on millions of Android phones that are still running on old Android versions starting from January 2025 as it evolves and adds new features that require modern OS and hardware.

  • WhatsApp’s support will end for Android KitKat and older versions.
  • The discontinuation affects popular brands like Samsung, LG, Sony, and HTC.
  • Specific models include: Samsung Galaxy S3, Galaxy Note 2, HTC One X, LG Nexus 4, among others.
  • Users are advised to upgrade their devices to continue using WhatsApp.
“Most people would ask why is anyone still using a phone with Android KitKat version, but the fact that WhatsApp still supports the OS means it has seen value for doing it.”

As technology continues to advance, older devices lose their compatibility with newer applications, making upgrades essential for continued service.

item.title: PUMA Releases New Jack Grealish Video in Celebration of the Future 8 Launch Edition - WebWire
item.description:
PUMA Releases New Jack Grealish Video in Celebration of the Future 8 Launch Edition

Date: Monday, December 23, 2024 | Source: WEBWIRE

The global sports brand PUMA has launched a new video featuring Manchester City star Jack Grealish to celebrate the release of the FUTURE 8 Launch Edition football boot.

  • The FUTURE 8 features innovative upgrades and a striking design with a white base and lime-green accents.
  • New technologies include the FUZIONFIT³ upper, providing a snug fit and flexibility.
  • The boot offers enhanced ball grip and control via a high-density mesh layer with GripControl Pro.
  • A unique FLEXGILITY outsole allows for superior agility and explosive movements.
  • The FUTURE 8 Launch Edition is now available in PUMA stores and online.
“Welcome to the FUTURE.”

The FUTURE 8's release aims to empower players to express their creativity on the field with advanced technology and design.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 Series 5G confirmed to launch in India: Expected price, features, and specs | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 Series 5G Confirmed for India: Price, Features, and Specs

Publication Date: December 23, 2024
Source: OPPO India

Oppo has officially confirmed the launch of its Reno 13 series 5G smartphones in India, following the success of the Reno 12 series. The release will feature two models: Reno 13 5G and Reno 13 Pro 5G, with teasers already circulating on social media.

  • The Reno 13 series will include a premium aluminium frame and a one-piece sculpted glass back.
  • It features a new camera module design with a triangular arrangement of three lenses and a potential ring light flash.
  • Specifications include a 6.59-inch AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and the MediaTek Dimensity 8350 chipset.
  • The 50MP primary camera includes optical image stabilization, with a 50MP front camera for selfies.
  • The series will run on ColorOS 15, based on Android 15, and aims for a competitive price in India.
“Familiar, yet so refreshingly new. Can you guess what’s coming?” — OPPO India

The pricing in China starts at CNY 2,699 (approx. ₹31,400), with Indian pricing yet to be announced.

This upcoming launch is expected to generate significant interest among technology enthusiasts and smartphone users in India.

item.title: Should chess players invest in their diet? - Sportstar
item.description:
Should Chess Players Invest in Their Diet?

Date: October 2023 | Source: The Hindu

Chess performance is closely tied to diet. The article explores how proper nutrition impacts focus, stamina, and mental clarity in chess players, debunking myths about calorie burning and emphasizing the importance of smart dietary choices for optimal performance.

  • High mental exertion can increase daily energy expenditure by 200-300 calories, not 6,000.
  • A proper diet can enhance memory and decision-making skills, crucial for chess.
  • Foods rich in Omega-3 fatty acids are vital for brain function.
  • Intermittent fasting and nootropic foods are emerging trends among cognitive athletes.
  • Genetic understanding may help players customize their diets for peak performance.
“The right diet could be your ultimate secret weapon.”

In conclusion, chess players can significantly benefit from focusing on their nutrition, as it directly influences their mental acuity and game performance.

item.title: Redmi A4 5G: Redefining Budget Smartphones in 2024 - Analytics Insight
item.description:
Redmi A4 5G: Redefining Budget Smartphones in 2024

Published on: 23 Dec 2024, 4:19 pm

The Redmi A4 5G brings innovative features to the budget smartphone category, combining powerful performance, a sleek design, and exceptional battery life at an attractive price point.

  • Design and Display: A sleek 6.88-inch HD+ display with 120Hz refresh rate protects eyes with TÜV certification.
  • Performance: Snapdragon 4s Gen 2 5G processor with up to 8GB RAM and 128GB storage.
  • Camera Quality: Dual-camera setup with a 50MP primary sensor for high-quality photos.
  • Battery Life: 5160mAh battery provides all-day usage with 18W fast charging.
  • Software Experience: Runs on Android 14 with Xiaomi's HyperOS for a smooth interface.
  • Connectivity: Supports 5G, Wi-Fi 5, Bluetooth 5.0, and GPS with IP52 rating for durability.
  • Value for Money: Priced at Rs. 8,499 for 4GB/64GB variant, offering great features for budget consumers.
“The Redmi A4 5G offers features and performance that make it a standout choice for budget-conscious consumers.”

This smartphone sets a new standard in the budget market, offering powerful capabilities typically found in higher-end models.

item.title: Meta reportedly adding display to Ray-Ban smart glasses in 2025 as Android XR nears - 9to5Google
item.description:
Meta reportedly adding display to Ray-Ban smart glasses in 2025 as Android XR nears

Publication Date: Not specified   Source: 9to5Google

A new report claims that Meta’s next Ray-Ban smart glasses will be adopting a display, coinciding with Google's and Samsung's moves towards Android XR integration.

  • Meta plans to launch Ray-Ban smart glasses with a display in the second half of 2025.
  • The glasses will reportedly be used for notifications and responses from Meta’s AI.
  • Previous designs were too costly, but a simpler display might be featured this time.
  • This development follows Google and Samsung's advancements in Android XR technology.
The updated Ray-Bans could be released as early as the second half of 2025, the people said. The small display would be likely to be used to show notifications or responses from Meta’s virtual assistant.

This initiative by Meta suggests a strategic move in the competitive landscape of smart glass technology, aiming to keep pace with other major players like Google and Samsung.

item.title: iPhone Sizes Change Next Year: What to Know - MacRumors
item.description:
iPhone Sizes Change Next Year: What to Know

Date & Source: Published on 2024-12-23 by MacRumors

Introduction: Apple is planning significant changes to iPhone sizes in 2025, with new display sizes for standard and 'Air' models, and potential design changes for Pro models.

  1. Standard iPhone 17: Apple could introduce a new display size of 6.3 inches for the standard iPhone 17 model in 2025, up from the current 6.1 inches.
  2. iPhone 17 Air: Rumors suggest that Apple plans to replace the Plus model with an 'Air' version, with display sizes ranging from 6.55 to 6.65 inches.
  3. iPhone 17 Pro & Pro Max: Apple is not expected to change the size of its Pro models next year, with the iPhone 17 Pro and Pro Max likely to retain display sizes of 6.3 inches and 6.9 inches, respectively. However, significant design changes are rumored.
  4. New Display Technology: Apple intends to expand ProMotion to all iPhone models in 2025, allowing for a 120Hz refresh rate, and may introduce Low-Dielectric TEE display technology and a more scratch-resistant anti-reflective display.
  5. Smaller Dynamic Island: The iPhone 17 Pro Max is rumored to feature a significantly narrower Dynamic Island.
  6. Historical Size Changes: A brief overview of significant iPhone size changes through the years.
What do you think about Apple's expected iPhone 17 size changes? Share your thoughts in the comments.

Popular Stories: iOS 19 Rumored to Be Compatible With These iPhones, Top 5 Apple Products to Look Forward to in 2025, and more.

item.title: MediaTek unveils Dimensity 8400 SoC for premium smartphones: All details - The Times of India
item.description:
MediaTek unveils Dimensity 8400 SoC for premium smartphones: All details

Publication Date: October 2023 Source: Tech News Daily

MediaTek has launched the Dimensity 8400 System-on-Chip (SoC) aimed at enhancing the performance of premium smartphones.

  • The Dimensity 8400 offers significant improvements in processing speed and energy efficiency.
  • It supports advanced gaming features, including ray tracing and vivid graphics.
  • 5G connectivity is enhanced with support for global bands.
  • MediaTek highlights its focus on optimizing AI capabilities within the chip.
"This new chip will redefine user experience in mobile devices, pushing the boundaries of performance and intelligence," said MediaTek CEO.

The introduction of the Dimensity 8400 SoC marks a critical advancement for MediaTek in the competitive smartphone market.

item.title: Nothing's upcoming phones could switch to Snapdragon and optical zoom cameras - Android Authority
item.description:
Nothing's Upcoming Phones Could Switch to Snapdragon and Optical Zoom Cameras

Publication Date: October 2023 • Source: Android Authority

Nothing has managed to create considerable hype in the smartphone space with its unique focus on style without compromising substance. Clues have emerged about upcoming budget phones, presumably the Nothing Phone 3a, Phone 3a Plus, and the CMF Phone 2.

  • We’ve spotted clues around three upcoming Nothing smartphones, presumably the Nothing Phone 3a, Phone 3a Plus, and the CMF Phone 2.
  • The Nothing Phone 3a and 3a Plus could sport the Qualcomm Snapdragon 7s Gen 3 SoC, while the CMF Phone 2 could stick with a MediaTek SoC.
  • The Phone 3a could adopt a telephoto camera, while the 3a Plus could upgrade to a periscope zoom.
Nothing Phone 3a series could be the first in the Nothing lineup to switch to dedicated sensors for optical zoom.

We’re still looking for clues to learn more about Nothing’s upcoming lineup. We’ll keep you updated when we find out.

item.title: We're Not Getting Saturn And Dreamcast Minis, But We Are Getting More Sega Mini-Arcades - Time Extension
item.description:
We're Not Getting Saturn And Dreamcast Minis, But We Are Getting More Sega Mini-Arcades

Date: December 24, 2024 Source: Time Extension

Sega's Western CEO Shuji Utsumi announced a deal with MyArcade for new retro gaming devices featuring classic titles, set to be revealed at CES 2025.

  • MyArcade will produce devices showcasing titles like Sonic and OutRun.
  • New products expected to retail between $39.99 and $59.99.
  • This reflects Sega's ongoing strategy to capitalize on classic IP without producing mini-consoles for Saturn and Dreamcast.
  • Sega's past collaborations have had mixed results, notably with AtGames.
“It would seem that Utsumi has decided to relax this policy.”

This new direction suggests Sega is revisiting its strategy to leverage classic franchises through partnerships.

item.title: Oppo Find X8 Pro review: Lost and found - The Financial Express
item.description:
Oppo Find X8 Pro Review: Lost and Found

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: Financial Express

The Oppo Find X8 Pro marks the brand's grand return to the flagship phone segment after a significant hiatus. It offers outstanding performance, an impressive display, and versatile camera capabilities, making it a strong contender against established leaders in the market.

  • The Find X8 series includes two models, with the Pro version priced at Rs 99,999.
  • Features a sleek design with a matte glass back and aluminum sides.
  • The phone boasts a 6.78-inch FHD+ AMOLED display with a refresh rate of up to 120Hz.
  • Offers a powerful battery life with 5,910mAh and fast charging capabilities.
  • Camera setup includes versatile telephoto options and impressive low-light performance.

“The Find X8 Pro is a compelling flagship phone that marks Oppo’s grand return to the premium segment.”

In conclusion, the Oppo Find X8 Pro is an excellent choice for those seeking a premium Android experience, offering top-notch features and performance, albeit at a competitive price point against Samsung and Apple.

item.title: Christmas 2024: Check best deals on flagship phones - iPhone 16 Pro, Galaxy S24 Plus and more | Mint - Mint
item.description:
Christmas 2024: Check best deals on flagship phones - iPhone 16 Pro, Galaxy S24 Plus and more

Publication Date: December 2024
Source: Live Mint

Christmas 2024 is approaching, prompting e-commerce platforms in India to launch festive sales with significant discounts on flagship smartphones.

  • The iPhone 15 Plus is available on Flipkart for ₹60,000, with additional bank offers bringing the price down to ₹59,999.
  • Samsung Galaxy S24 Plus (256GB model) is listed at ₹65,000 on Flipkart.
  • Samsung Galaxy S23 can be purchased for ₹37,999 for the base 128GB model.
  • iPhone 16 Pro is discounted to ₹1,16,900 on Amazon, with potential further savings using credit cards.
“This is excellent value for the latest iPhone 16 Pro.”

With festive sales ongoing, consumers are encouraged to take advantage of these competitive prices on flagship mobile devices.

item.title: Oppo Reno 13 5G Series India Launch Teased; Design, Colour Options, Availability Revealed - Gadgets 360
item.description:
Oppo Reno 13 5G Series India Launch, Design, Colour Options Confirmed

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Gadgets 360

The Oppo Reno 13 5G series, previously launched in China, is set to launch in India soon. The handsets have confirmed designs and colour options, with the upcoming models anticipated to succeed the Reno 12 series.

  • Oppo Reno 13 series includes base and Pro variants.
  • Expected release on Flipkart and Oppo India e-store.
  • Available in two RAM and storage configurations.
  • Base model features Ivory White and Luminous Blue shades.
  • Pro model available in Graphite Grey and Mist Lavender.
  • Both models equipped with 50-megapixel cameras and large batteries.
“Both phones will have an aerospace-grade aluminium frame.”

More details about the launch date and additional specifications will be revealed soon.
